definition: to bestow (a reward)/to give (to an inferior)/to hand down/a reward (bestowed by a superior)/to appreciate (beauty)

sentences.english: The audiences enjoyed the moon and the lanterns while solving the riddles in a relaxed way.
sentences.chinese: 中秋夜人们将谜条张贴在各种花灯之上，赏月猜谜。

sentences.english: We will watch the moon tonight , and look for Chang are and Wu Gang.
sentences.chinese: 我们今晚赏月，去找嫦娥和吴刚。

sentences.english: Today people will enjoy the full moon and eat moon cakes on that day.
sentences.chinese: 如今人们在中秋节那天都会赏月并吃月饼。

sentences.english: In the hot spring pool to enjoy the moonlight.
sentences.chinese: 在夜色朦胧的温泉池下赏月。

sentences.english: In a full-moon night celebrate together with family is happiness.
sentences.chinese: 能在中秋月圆之夜与家人一起赏月是幸福。

sentences.english: People eat the delicious food while they are enjoying a beautiful full moon in their yard.
sentences.chinese: 人们都在自家的院子里一边赏月一边吃着可口的月饼。

sentences.english: People can enjoy the moon while eating moon-cakes which are the special food for this festival.
sentences.chinese: 人们可以赏月，一边吃月饼是这个节日的特殊食品。

sentences.english: The moon night, drunk the JiangFan and found no sad but to the fields.
sentences.chinese: 是夜，赏月独醉的姜凡并没有发现悄但是至的田野。

sentences.english: People look at the moon at night with their families.
sentences.chinese: 人们在夜晚和家人一起赏月。

sentences.english: Some 1, 400 people showed up for a viewing party at the observatory.
sentences.chinese: 那时约有1400人在观测站出席了赏月食的晚会。

sentences.english: Ancient have autumn offerings months of club system, folk also have the wind of the Mid-Autumn moon.
sentences.chinese: 古有秋天祭月的社制，民间也有中秋赏月之风。

sentences.english: In China, families get together and celebrate the bright, round moon.
sentences.chinese: 中秋节这天，每家都要团聚在一起赏月。

sentences.english: But it is the drama of the moonrise that I come to see.
sentences.chinese: 我出来赏月是因为月出这部剧目。

definition: the Mid-autumn festival, the traditional moon-viewing festival on the 15th of the 8th lunar month
fine time, beautiful scenery (idiom); everything lovely
refined and elegant attitude of mind
to cool off in the shade
lit. tread the green; go for a walk in the spring (when the grass has turned green)/spring hike season around Qingming festival 清明, 4th-6th April
